title: 107_hr673
content: The Act is titled the "Charity To Eliminate Poverty Tax Credit Act of 2001" and introduces a new section for a tax credit for charitable contributions to certain private charities assisting the poor. The "Charity To Eliminate Poverty Tax Credit Act of 2001" allows individuals a tax credit for qualified charitable contributions made to qualified charities, limited to $100 ($200 for joint returns). Qualified charitable contributions must be made in cash and identified on the tax return. A qualified charity is defined as an organization that meets certain criteria. A qualified charity, as defined by the "Charity To Eliminate Poverty Tax Credit Act of 2001," is an organization certified by the Secretary under section 501(c)(3), primarily assisting individuals with incomes below 150 percent of the official poverty line. The charity must be organized in the US or a qualified state and file returns under section 6033. The "Charity To Eliminate Poverty Tax Credit Act of 2001" defines a qualified charity as an organization certified under section 501(c)(3) that primarily assists individuals with incomes below 150 percent of the official poverty line. The organization must meet a minimum expenditure requirement to carry out its exempt purpose activities. The "Charity To Eliminate Poverty Tax Credit Act of 2001" defines a qualified charity as an organization certified under section 501(c)(3) that primarily assists individuals with incomes below 150 percent of the official poverty line. The organization must meet a minimum expenditure requirement to carry out its exempt purpose activities. Contributions made for administrative expenses, influencing legislation, fundraising, or litigation on behalf of individuals are not considered tax-deductible. Contributions made by the taxpayer before the deadline for filing the tax return can be treated as made on the last day of the taxable year. The tax credit for qualified charitable contributions is in lieu of any deduction allowable under the tax code. Taxpayers can elect to not apply this credit for a taxable year. The maximum credit amount is adjusted for inflation annually. The tax credit for qualified charitable contributions is adjusted annually for inflation. Increases are rounded to the nearest multiple of $5. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the tax code. The amendments to the tax credit for charitable contributions apply to contributions made after the 90th day following the enactment of the Act in taxable years ending after that date.
